input_text:
Job Title: Manufacturing Quality Engineer

Location: Oxford, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
GENERAL JOB SUMMARY: 

This position is responsible for TDI’s product quality, from purchase order to ship, of turbine engines and components produced at TDI’s facility and external suppliers. The Manufacturing Quality Engineer (MQE) will resolve manufacturing & shipment issues relative to customer specifications. The MQE will support the administration of TDI’s quality processes, documentation, continuous improvement initiatives & interaction with external and internal personnel on quality initiatives. The MQE will be responsible for conception, evaluation, and implementation of root cause analysis & corrective/preventative action of quality and compliance issues.

Tasks include developing and initiating standards and methods of inspection, testing and evaluation, inspecting to ensure that critical and complex aerospace components meet all customer specifications and blueprint requirements while implementing cost reduction initiatives and part/process improvement activities.

 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: 

Identify and correct external supplier quality escapes.Investigate and analyze root causes of failures/errors.Develops and implement correction and preventative action plans to include mistake-proof solutions.Conduct qualification/re-qualification of existing suppliers as well as initial qualification of new/alternate suppliers.Prepare quality data packages and additional support to customer quality/supply chain management personnel.Develop internal manufacturing, quality, and supply system requirements – document and enforce accordingly.Conduct internal quality audits and support routine and non-routine AS9100 audit activities.Maintain and execute all aspects of TDI’s AS9100 quality system.Define and implement control plans and FMEA or similar analysis per customer requirements.Collect, analyze, and prepare statistical data as required to support engine programs and customer requests.Support cost-reduction initiatives by providing recommendations to improve manufacturing and supply chain.Provide input to business development and management personnel to support proposals and purchases.Review TDI engine and product BOM and maintain product compliance to customer and industry specifications and standards to include DoD/Government and commercial references.Regularly interface with supply chain management, material handling, and shipping/receiving personnelKeep company management informed of all issues, problems, and accomplishments on assigned programs

Other Job Functions

Work independently and with minimal direction/oversight.Must be at assigned worksite during assigned hours 100% of time; less PTO, FML/STD/LTDOther duties may be assigned as required to support TDI’s products and line of business.

 SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: 

This position has no supervisory responsibilities at this time.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: 

Ability to maintain sensitive and confidential information as required by government standards

Ability to interact effectively with peers and supervisors

Ability to interact appropriately with the public and visitors when necessary

Ability to adhere to workplace rules

Ability to present thoughts, concepts, and program status before high level customers, management and colleagues

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering preferred. Will consider a combination of education/certification with at least 10 years of documented manufacturing and quality management system experience in lieu of degree.Experience implementing quality controls and manufacturing solutions is strongly desired.Proficiency in manufacturing processes, inspection (CMM/GD&T) and quality processes.General PC use, MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint experience required.Working knowledge of supplier negotiations and management strongly desired.Experienced in aerospace and defense manufacturing sector and supply chain is strongly desired.Experience with technical disciplines to include but not limited to: Mechanical & Electrical Engineering, Purchasing/Buyers, Production/Operations, Testing, and Manufacturing.DoD MIL Standards and Specifications experience preferred.Experience in ITAR production environments a plus.AS9100 and ISO9000 experience preferred.

WORK ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Office and production environments

Ability to stand and sit for long periods of time

Ability to adhere to compamny and industrial safety standards and protocols

Ability to perform repetitive motion

THE ABOVE STATEMENTS ARE INTENDED TO DESCRIBE THE GENERAL NATURE AND LEVEL OF WORK BEING PERFORMED BY INDIVIDUALS ASSIGNED TO THIS CLASSIFICATION. THEY ARE NOT INTENDED TO BE CONSTRUED AS AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES AND SKILLS REQUIRED OF PERSONNEL SO CLASSIFIED.

A REVIEW OF THIS CLASSIFICATION HAS EXCLUDED THE MARGINAL FUNCTIONS OF THE CLASSIFICATION THAT ARE INCIDENTAL TO THE PERFORMANCE OF FUNDAMENTAL JOB JUTIES. ALL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ARE ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND REQUIREMENTS AND ARE SUBJECT TO POSSIBLE MODIFICATION TO REASONABLY ACCOMMODATE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO PERFORM THIS JOB PROFICIENTLY. THE REQUIREMENTS LISTED IN THIS DOCUMENT ARE THE MINIMUM LEVELS OF KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS OR ABILITIES

EE0/M/F/D/V

 
Kratos Defense is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer. EOE, Minorities, Females, Vet, Disabled, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity or any other protected class. All qualified job seekers are encouraged to apply. Kratos Defense is committed to America's veterans by providing opportunities for them to continue contributing after service to our nation. We also work to provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.

EEO Is The Law

Disability Accessibility Accommodation
If you require an accommodation to navigate or apply to our careers site, please send your request to HRAccessibility@kratosdefense.com or call 858-964-2916. Any inquires not related to requesting an accommodation will be discarded.

Pay Transparency
The company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

Job Applicant Privacy Notice
For applicants in the EU and California residents, please review our privacy notice.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
